intro: Sesamoides latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf sesamoid, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
